messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Earthquakes, which are sudden movements of the Earth's surface that can cause damage, can hurt many structures, including bridges. Bridges are strong structures that help people and vehicles cross rivers or roads. Luckily, damage like bridges falling down because of earthquakes does not happen very often, especially with modern bridges. Engineers, who are people trained to design and build structures, have learned how to make bridges in places where earthquakes happen. They build bridges on land that is more stable and does not move much during an earthquake, so the bridges are safer.
